1.text: Sketch in the head as a large egg-like shape centered on the page.

2.text: Draw the ears with 2 smaller egg-like shapes on top of the head.

3.text: Make an oval for the body that’s about the same size as the head.

4.text: Sketch in 3 pairs of ovals for 2 front legs and a rear leg.

5.text: Add a cloud-, thought bubble-, or bean-shaped tail.

6.text: Define the features of the fox within your rough outline.

7.text: Darken the finishing lines and erase your original sketching lines.

8.text: Color your cartoon fox to finish it off.

9.text: Sketch a circle in the middle of the page for the fox’s head.

10.text: Add 3 egg-shaped ovals to the head for the ears and muzzle.

11.text: Overlap the bottom right of the head with a slightly larger circle for the neck.

12.text: Sketch out a much larger oval to represent the fox’s body.

13.text: Connect a set of elongated ovals to represent the front legs and feet.

14.text: Follow a similar process with 4 ovals for the rear legs and feet.

15.text: Draw the tail out of a long, nearly banana-shaped oval.

16.text: Refine the fox's body shape and add facial features.

17.text: Darken your refinements with pen and erase the pencil outlines.

18.text: Color the drawing, if desired, to finish it off.

19.text: Start with a circle and a curved line extending from its bottom left.

20.text: Sketch in the pointed ears and rounded snout on the circular head.

21.text: Add another circle and curved line to outline the fox’s body and rear thigh.

22.text: Use more ovals and lines to outline the tail and legs.

23.text: Thicken the legs and add triangles for the front paws.

24.text: Sketch in the face and create a jagged outline to represent fur.

25.text: Darken your detailed lines with pen and erase your penciled-in sketch lines.

26.text: Add some color to your fox drawing if you wish.
